Hingga November, 450 Hektare Lahan Gunung Tambora Terbakar
05 Nov 2019, 13:31 by Faruk Nickyrawi


Kebakaran Hutan Gunung Tambora (Istimewa)

Dompu - Menjelang akhir tahun 2019, sampai dengan bulan November, 450 hektare lahan di Gunung Tambora, Dompu, Nusa Tenggara Barat (NTB) tercatat sudah mengalami kebakaran hutan (karhut) hebat.Awalnya, luas lahan yang terbakar di gunung Tambora mencapai 80 hektare saja. Namun setelah kebakaran hebat yang terjadi pada pertengahan Oktober lalu, luas kawasan meningkat drastis."Luas lahan yang terbakar sejak Agustus-November ini sekitar 450 hektare," kata Kepala Balai TN Tambora Murlan Dameria Pane, pada detikcom, Selasa (05/11/2019).450 hektare tersebut tersebar di semua wilayah kawasan taman nasional, seperti di Resor Pancasila, Resir Doroncanga, Resor Kawindo Toi, dan Resor Piong.Karena tidak ada lagi ditemukan munculnya titik api, TN Tambora juga kini telah membuka kembali pendakian yang sebelumnya ditutup sementara. 4 pintu pendakian di semua resor bisa dilakukan untuk aktivitas pendakian."Beberapa hari ini tidak ada karhut di kawasan TN Tambora. Mulai hari ini pendakian sudah dibuka kembali. Semua jalur pendakian kita buka kembali setelah kita putuskan untuk menutup sementara beberapa waktu lalu," ujar Murlan.

Until November, 450 hectares of Mount Tambora land was burned
05 Nov 2019, 13:31 by Faruk Nickyrawi


Mount Tambora Forest Fire (Special)

Dompu - Towards the end of 2019, until November, 450 hectares of land on Mount Tambora, Dompu, West Nusa Tenggara (NTB) has been recorded as having experienced severe forest fires (karhut). Initially, the area of land burned on Mount Tambora reached 80 hectares alone . But after the great fire that occurred in mid-October, the area increased dramatically. "The area of land burned since August-November is around 450 hectares," said Head of Tambora National Park Murlan Dameria Pane, in AFP on Tuesday (11/05/2019 ). 450 hectares are scattered in all areas of the national park area, such as in the Pancasila Resort, Resir Doroncanga, Kawindo Toi Resort, and Piong Resort. Since there are no more hotspots, Tambora National Park has now reopened the ascent which was previously temporarily closed . 4 climbing doors in all resorts can be done for climbing activities. "Some days there is no forest fires in the Tambora National Park area. Starting today, the climb has been reopened. All our hiking routes have reopened after we decided to temporarily close some time ago," he said. Murlan.
